title: Function handleUpdates could be reentered
content:
## Severity: Low Risk

## Context
- Keystore.sol#L17-L40
- Keystore.sol#L94-L96

## Description
A malicious verifier could reenter `handleUpdates()` while the nonce isn't incremented yet. This way, it could potentially allow processing the same action again and increase the nonce multiple times. Luckily, `validateData()` is a view function and thus updates (even when reentered) can't be made, which lowers the potential impact. 

> Note: A malicious verifier could also just allow every action, which would be worse.

## Recommendation
If `validateData()` would ever be changed to allow updates or another external call is added that allows updates:
- Consider adding a `nonReentrant` modifier.
- Alternatively, consider checking in `_incrementNonce()` that the correct nonce value is still present.

## Stackup
Fixed in PR 52.

## Spearbit
Fix verified.
